learning_objectives.description: Measure and draw lines and angles.
Construct a triangle, given the lengths of all sides, using a ruler and pair of compasses only.

subtopic.notes_and_examples:
A ruler should be used for all straight edges.
Constructions of perpendicular bisectors and angle bisectors are not required.
e.g. construct a rhombus by drawing two triangles. Construction arcs must be shown.
Examples include:
• draw nets of cubes, cuboids, prisms and pyramids
• use measurements from nets to calculate volumes and surface areas.
